title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 June 2009 - XWiki
content:

vmassol\_ joined #xwiki at 13:10

vnkatesh joined #xwiki at 16:17  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 16:20): starting xwiki-core-2.0-dev-20090609 release  
asyd - (09/06/2009 16:20): !!!  
asyd - (09/06/2009 16:20): when you'll stop :)  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 16:22): :)  
asyd - (09/06/2009 16:22): btw, beer this friday?  
lucien joined #xwiki at 16:24  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 16:25): I can't this WE  
asyd - (09/06/2009 16:27): ok  
Chathurag joined #xwiki at 16:33  
Chathurag - (09/06/2009 16:35): Sdumitriu: hai  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 16:35): Hi Chathurag  
jvelociter left at 16:37 ()  
Chathurag - (09/06/2009 16:37): I tried the javascript extention as u said... But I feel that velocity scripts are not working.Any hints to fix it  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 16:40): Make sure you enable parsing on the extension  
anamarias left at 16:40 ()  
Chathurag - (09/06/2009 16:41): yes I did that  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 16:42): Is the document in the 2.0 syntax?  
Chathurag - (09/06/2009 16:42): nope  
Chathurag - (09/06/2009 16:42): 1.0  
jk\_work - (09/06/2009 16:43): anybody know if balsamiq mockups can be made to work with 2.0 syntax?   I get {pre}{/pre} when I wrap them in {velocity} tags  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 16:43): Then it should work  
jk\_work - (09/06/2009 16:46): ^- "Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page Macros.VelocityMacro Wrapped Exception: Failed to evaluate content with id"  
jk\_work - (09/06/2009 16:47): oh, there its fixed now  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 16:55): tmortagne: it's not 1.9RC2 it's 1.9  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 16:55): (there will be no 1.9RC2)  
jk\_work - (09/06/2009 16:56): tmortagne: does it make sense to show an example macro include outside of the velocity block as described in the yellow note?  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 16:56): vmassol\_: i know but jv did not renamed the release note yet and i just wanted to update it, i will let him fix it  
kaaloo left at 16:57 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 16:57): tmortagne: I think we could help him  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 16:57): vmassol\_: sure but i did not know what he had planned  
sdumitriu left at 16:58 ("Leaving.")  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 16:58): jvdrean: what have you planned?  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 16:59): vmassol\_: about JIRA I've planned to delete the 1.9 release and to rename 1.9RC2  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 17:00): is that what you mean ?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): jvdrean: I dno't know....  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): (it's thomas who was asking!)  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): :)  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): so there jira yes  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): then the code (I'm doing that now)  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): then the release notes  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:00): the maven/build  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 17:01): by code you mean @since tags or something else ?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:01): ./xwiki-officeimporter/src/test/java/org/xwiki/officeimporter/internal/MockDocumentNameSerializer.java: \* @since 1.9RC2  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:01): ./xwiki-officeimporter/src/test/java/org/xwiki/officeimporter/internal/VelocityContextInitializerTest.java: \* @since 1.9RC2  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:01): ./xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/renderer/ParametersPrinter.java: \* @since 1.9RC2  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:01): yep  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:01): I'm fixing those  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:01): this make me think i forget some @since AFAIK  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:02): i'm adding them  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:04): vmassol: I'm trying to run xwiki rendering standalone.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:04): with http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-standalone/src/it/example/src/test/java/org/xwiki/rendering/example/ExampleTest.java  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:04): vnkatesh: cool  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:04): there, I'm having a problem...  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:04): (what's your use case btw?)  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:04): after importing all dependencies..  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:04): I'll be trying to use a standalone renderer fro xeclipse  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:05): vmassol: so ecm.lookup throws ComponentLookupException  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:05): vnkatesh: on what role/hint?  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:05): vmassol\_: so ecm.lookup throws ComponentLookupException  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:05): vmassol: sorry?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:06): have you called initialize()?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:06): do you have the requested component in your classloader?  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:06): yes  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:06): I have  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:07): org.xwiki.component.manager is supposed to contain ComponentLookupException, but it does not.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:07): I'm using the lastest sources.  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:08): can you paste your error with pastebin?  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:09): vmassol\_: I'm not trying to run it yet..eclipse's showing me the errors.  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:09): vnkatesh: so you have a pb in your eclipse setup  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:09): since it's building fine  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:10): vmassol\_: building fine for you?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:10): no for everyone  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:10): :)  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:10): see hudson  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:10): hudson.xwiki.or  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:10): ok :) I'll let you know.  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:10): hudson.xwiki.org  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 17:10): thanks.  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 17:14): vmassol\_ tmortagne : jira renaming don  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 17:14): done  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:15): ok @since done too  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:15): jvdrean: btw we need to aggregate all release notes from M1, M2, etc for 1.9   
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 17:15): yes  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:15): tmortagne: are you done on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/VelocityMacro ? I think it's not very clear and missing some stuff  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:16): vmassol\_: no it's just a first draft  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:16): the filters should be put at the end, it's missing the $nl, $sp  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:16): filters explanations could be improved too  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:16): ok  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:17): let me know when you're done  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 17:39  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:41): vmassol\_: what do you mean by "the filters should be put at the end" ? after Result ?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:41): tmortagne: most users won't need filters  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:41): they don't even need to know about it  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:42): so yes I meant after example and result  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:42): maybe even on a different pages I don't know  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:42): but they need to know why the velocity script does not behave like a normal velocity script  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:42): wdym?  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:42): since by defaultwe apply a filter  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): yes they need to know the default way of entering velocity code  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): with $nl and $sp  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): but they don't need to know that it's a filter   
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): that's it called html  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): etc  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): how it works  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:43): this is what takes the most of the place in what i added  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:43): this is advanced topic  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:45): we still need to explain them somewhere how to disable the filter by putting the none filter if they already have lots of script  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:45): tmortagne: btw the example is now incorrect  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:45): tmortagne: I'm not saying we should explain filters  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:45): s/should/shouldn't/  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:45): just that right now I doubt anyone will understand anything  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:45): I just added the filters part yet, need to update the rest of the doc  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:47): vmassol\_:  actually now the example is correct, it was incorrect previously  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:48): tmortagne: well the example is not explicit enough now  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:48): maybe a list item will make it explciit  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:50): what is not explicit ?  
vmassol\_ - (09/06/2009 17:51): what it does. whether the user wants the words on the same line or not  
tmortagne - (09/06/2009 17:53): "Some velocity code" sound explicit to me that it's a same sentence

vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 18:43): for xwiki rendering standalone..

vmassol - (09/06/2009 18:45): this one: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-parsers/xwiki-rendering-parser-wikimodel/  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 18:45): ok, thanks.

fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 18:48): vnkatesh: you just have to refresh the element after that an attachment is uploaded

tachirei joined #xwiki at 18:49  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 18:51): going home... be back in less than 1h  
fmancinelli left at 18:51 ()  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 18:53): fmancinelli: Yes, but I'm unsure with NotificationManager's working for the attachment-refresh thing. will see into it.  
jvdrean - (09/06/2009 19:02): releasing xwiki-core-1.9

vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:00): fmancinelli: there?  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:00): vnkatesh: yes  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:00): hi, about the offline rendering in xeclipse.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:00): I've gone through the standalone rendering code.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:01): and made it work.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:01): now, how exactly would we use it in xeclipse?  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:01): it produces html code.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:01): do we feed that to the existing inbuilt-browser (is that possible?)  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:02): or something else has to be done?  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:18): I was thinking of feeding it to a browser component  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:19): which already exists, as in mozilla-browser component, right?  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:19): vnkatesh: yes. We already have a "preview" view but I would leave it for previewing the whole page when connected  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:19): ok.  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:19): vnkatesh: or we could make the following thing... if connected  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:20): vnkatesh: the preview view displays the page as it is on the remote wiki  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:20): I'll have to see to it then, how to feed html content to browser.. I thought it rendered the URL directly.  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:20): vnkatesh: if it isn't connected it displays the preview in html  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:20): \*used the URL directly  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:20): vnkatesh: ah right. I don't know actually  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:21): vnkatesh: but in the worst case we might create a temp file and point the browser to it  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:21): vnkatesh: it would be better to feed it directly if it's possible  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:21): yes, i thought of that too, but that is not the best way to do it.  
vnkatesh - (09/06/2009 21:21): yes.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:22  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 21:31  
jvdrean left at 21:32 (Client Quit)  
florinciu left at 21:39 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:47): vnkatesh: a rapid look to the browser component makes me think that it's not possible to feed html directly so the temp file seems to be the only way to go  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:48): vnkatesh: spoke too fast :)  
cypromis joined #xwiki at 21:49  
fmancinelli - (09/06/2009 21:49): vnkatesh: there's the setText method that does exactly that http://help.eclipse.org/stable/nftopic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/api/org/eclipse/swt/browser/Browser.html#setText(java.lang.String)

sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:03): Hi anamarias\_  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:03): Any more progress? Or have you been busy with school and stuff?  
anamarias\_ - (09/06/2009 23:06): hi sdumitriu , yes, unfortunately i've been working only on my diploma project these days. it's due soon now, on the 17th  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:09): No problem, just checking up  
anamarias\_ - (09/06/2009 23:10): i know i'm a bit behind, and i'm starting to get a bit frustrated about it. can't wait to have my full attention on the project...  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:19): bafta anamarias\_ :)  
anamarias\_ - (09/06/2009 23:19): thanks jvelociter   
arunreddy\_\_ joined #xwiki at 23:20  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:20): jvelociter: Test: Cât e ceasul?  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:21): No searching, please  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:22): so I'll have to guess  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:22): ...  
anamarias\_ - (09/06/2009 23:23): :) jvelociter knows romanian v good. he managed to translate his horoscope almost perfectly when he was in bucharest ...  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:23): sdumitriu: da  
sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:23): jvelociter: Nope, guess again  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:23): (ok I don't have much hope with that)  
jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:23): aha

jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:25): was simpler :D

jvelociter - (09/06/2009 23:26): yes, I guess the neologisms helped

sdumitriu - (09/06/2009 23:27): Hi cristinaS  
cristinaS - (09/06/2009 23:28): hi!
